title: File descriptor not closed in CatBoostTreeModelLoader ctor
body:
I was getting the following warnings via Python's unit test library:
```
unclosed file <_io.TextIOWrapper name='/tmp/tmpbwbd1dwm' mode='r' encoding='UTF-8'>
```

I traced the issue to https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/9d7de4dee742ce10684400171257c66a86e4c7a6/shap/explainers/_tree.py#L1584
```
class CatBoostTreeModelLoader:
    def __init__(self, cb_model):
        # cb_model.save_model("cb_model.json", format="json")
        # self.loaded_cb_model = json.load(open("cb_model.json", "r"))
        import tempfile
        tmp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile()
        cb_model.save_model(tmp_file.name, format="json")
        self.loaded_cb_model = json.load(open(tmp_file.name, "r"))
        tmp_file.close()
```

Note the `open()` call inside `json.load()` without a context manager or corresponding `close()`.

Cpython will probably close this descriptor when it ref counts, but the Python docs explicitly warn you not to do this:

> Other implementations act differently and CPython may change. Do not depend on immediate finalization of objects when they become unreachable (so you should always close files explicitly).

https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#objects-values-and-types.

I am not familiar with shap, but the fix is probably calling json.load() on the already file-like `tmp_file` directly:
```
        self.loaded_cb_model = json.load(tmp_file)
```
